text:
i use Struts and JSTL tags. When Struts Action throws exception, the error jsp page would be opened as to catch and display the exception. You know, Struts set exception infos to request attribute Global.EXCEPTION_KEY ("org.apache.struts.action.EXCEPTION"). So, if use struts logic & bean tag, it looks like this:

Stack

    <%
    		Exception e = (Exception) request
    		.getAttribute("org.apache.struts.action.EXCEPTION");
    		e.printStackTrace(new PrintWriter(out));
    %>
If changed to jstl, it would like this:

Stack

    <%
    		Exception e = (Exception) request
    		.getAttribute("org.apache.struts.action.EXCEPTION");
    		e.printStackTrace(new PrintWriter(out));
    %>
But the EL parse class explains the expression as org object,and apache attribute... So, how to do if using the JSTL?
